page.title: 01The Ballachulish Bridge Area
page.content: The Ballachulish Bridge area is scenically very beautiful with mountains rising steeply out of the sea. Ballachulish Bay, 5 on grid is deep enough to take ocean liners. The villages & road which connects them are all on the narrow coastal strip. The bridge replaced a ferry & has cut about 15 miles from the A82. Tourism is the main industry bringing jobs & money to the people though this is mainly seasonal as well as hotel accommodation, many homes provide B&B. Quite a number work in Fort William the market town, the secondary school is there. Other jobs are in forestry & Local Council. Tourists visiting for the scenery, climbers for the hills come all year. In the summer, campers & an increasing number of small boats sailing in the sheltered waters bring work to more areas.
